From: Iheb Mhamdi <iheb.mhamdi@dnext.io>

To: Nicolas Chaperon <nicolas.chaperon@dnext.io>; Benoit Baliguet <benoit.baliguet@dnext.io>

Subject: Re: Follow up on 'Location Filter Value Problem' email 
 
Hello Nicolas,
Still facing the same problem, when I change to REGION the NATIONAL_REGION are not appearing and it goes both ways, and I have both hierarchies in my dataset, is there a way to disable the filtering ?
Tried to leave it empty and save on that configuration but it gets back to the default configuration (as shown in screenshot 2 and 3)
I checked another dataset where I have the same methodology (multiple hierarchies) and it seems that the filter value is not applied (screenshot 4)









Dataset Without Filter Value:

________________________________

From: Nicolas Chaperon <nicolas.chaperon@dnext.io>
Sent: Thursday, October 2, 2025 11:07 PM
To: Iheb Mhamdi <iheb.mhamdi@dnext.io>; Benoit Baliguet <benoit.baliguet@dnext.io>
Cc: Customer Success <customer.success@dnext.io>; Lucas Rosa <lucas.rosa@dnext.io>; Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Follow up on 'Location Filter Value Problem' email 
 
Hello,

Issue was elsewhere as you supposed. I've created a ticket for this: https://dnext.atlassian.net/browse/DNP-5707 <https://dnext.atlassian.net/browse/DNP-5707> .

In the meantime you can now update the structure of your dataset correctly and change the hierarchy/level_name of the fields as you want, this should unstuck you. Btw in term of flow if you encounter an issue, raise a ticket to support instead, so we can follow-up in JIRA.




________________________________

From: Iheb Mhamdi <iheb.mhamdi@dnext.io>
Sent: Thursday, October 02, 2025 22:28
To: Benoit Baliguet <benoit.baliguet@dnext.io>; Nicolas Chaperon <nicolas.chaperon@dnext.io>
Cc: Customer Success <customer.success@dnext.io>; Lucas Rosa <lucas.rosa@dnext.io>; Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>
Subject: Follow up on 'Location Filter Value Problem' email 

Hello @Benoit Baliguet <mailto:benoit.baliguet@dnext.io>  and @Nicolas Chaperon <mailto:nicolas.chaperon@dnext.io> ,
The issue might be other than that also. Even when I tried to keep only ARG and deleted the other region names in the input file, I was still unable to map the country.
Thanks,
Iheb

To: Iheb Mhamdi <iheb.mhamdi@dnext.io>; Benoit Baliguet <benoit.baliguet@dnext.io>

Hello,

Issue was elsewhere as you supposed. I've created a ticket for this: https://dnext.atlassian.net/browse/DNP-5707.

In the meantime you can now update the structure of your dataset correctly and change the hierarchy/level_name of the fields as you want, this should unstuck you. Btw in term of flow if you encounter an issue, raise a ticket to support instead, so we can follow-up in JIRA.

Thanks,
Iheb
